I understand that you are not pleased with our offer of an inflight gift voucher of SGD100 as stated in my previous email to you. Alternatively we may offer you a transport voucher of AUD100. The transportation voucher is valid for one year and can be used towards payment of a future flight ticket for travel on Singapore Airlines or SilkAir and is applicable for bookings made directly through the Singapore Airlines or SilkAir Reservations and Ticketing Office, the Singapore Airlines or SilkAir websites, and authorized travel agents. The voucher can also be used to offset excess baggage charges. Please bring along the voucher, with your photo ID, to our Singapore Airlines or SilkAir Reservations Ticketing Office for a refund of the value indicated on the voucher once you have a confirmed booking.

We hope that you would be a in a position to reconsider our offer. We look forward to your reply.

Yours sincerely

Stella Tan
Customer Affairs Manager
Singapore Airlines Limited

Sorry to hear this. We do not charge differently based on aircraft type or confirm the final aircraft type during booking as we understand that aircraft type may change due to operational requirements. Much as we would like to deploy the latest aircraft types on all our routes, we seek your understanding that this may not always be possible. However, we are working on upgrading our fleet across all our destinations and we hope to provide better options for the Tokyo route in future.

Im sorry SIA,  but I would expect clear indication of the flight type. Don't tell me I can use the booking Center. I expect this information on the website during booking. Everything else looks kind of cheating to me. Less service, super old business class on same prize. How you would call this?

Dear Lutz, the aircraft type will be shown when one makes a booking online, at the point when he or she is selecting the flights - when you click on the drop down arrow next to the flight number, the aircraft type planned for the flight will be shown. However, as mentioned earlier, we cannot confirm the final aircraft type at the point of booking as we understand that the aircraft type may change due to operational requirements. We seek your understanding that there is no intention on our part to withhold any information from our passengers.
wow thats a rip off from sq...
It is not a ripoff. There is already a disclaimer when you book. You need to read.

Also , there is a legal disclaimer that says that the aircraft type can change without notice due to operational reasons . I know it sux and your dreams are  crushed but this is something beyond the airline's control .

Sorry I meant ETD rather than ETA.

Hi Hiskandar, sorry to hear that. Our ground team was not able to give a more accurate update as the situation at the airport remains fluid. As of now, they are still working with the airport authorities to establish a more accurate time of departure. Nevertheless, do approach any available staff if you require further assistance. Please bear with us in the meantime. Thank you.

Well, I've just heard some announcements, so that's fine. I really do understand that you need to manage expectations. Nobody wants to hear you announce we will board at X hrs only for you to delay it by an hour subsequently. 

I don't know what the right way to strike the balance is. Personally, I am comforted every time I get a direct update over the PA system from SQ. =D
Hi Hiskandar, thanks for letting us know. We appreciate your patience all this while. Wishing you a pleasant flight ahead with your family. :)

So current ETD is 0145h. My younger kid is sleeping while slumped across my shoulder while my older one is putting up an admirable fight without complaint. 

Dear fellow passengers - I also don't like travelling on flights with screaming kids. Thus, we try our best to make sure we minimise such occasions. However, when this flight departs, there's very little left I can do to stop the tears and screaming. Sorry, guys and gals.
Over 12 hours later, we are in KLIA on a transit because of a needed crew change. By way of explanation, crew gave one about 1 hour before landing in KLIA, and this generic looking letter.

Hi Hiskandar, sorry if our staff were not able to explain the rationale behind the crew change. Due to operational exigencies our staff were not able to prepare a revised delay notice on time. If we may share, for every set of crew that we deploy, there is a flight time limitation for their duty beyond which it would not be advisable for them to continue with their duty, due to fatigue. As we will never compromise the safety of our passengers onboard, it is imperative that a crew change be made. Our ground staff in Singapore will do their best to render any assistance to the passengers upon the aircraft's arrival in Changi.

Hi, I fully understand the reasons for the stopover, and I don't have a problem with that. What I do have issue with is the way we are updated on what is going on. 

An announcement that we were going to stopover in KL was made about an hour before we landed. Some time before that, I had noticed that the flight status showed us going to KL. Then this letter comes after we land in KL but was prepared by the SM in Dubai. 

When the situation is bad, information coming in dribs and drabs worsens the perception of the actual situation. 

I feel bad for the crew from Dubai and KL because chances are, the flight was one of those where abuse is endlessly heaped on the staff as a result of the passengers' frustration.

Hiskandar Zulkarnaen Hasshim Thank you for your feedback, Hiskandar. Indeed, there are lessons to be learnt from the handling of this delay, especially the communications aspect as per what you had highlighted. As with any delay, we will be reviewing the handling via a thorough post-mortem, scrutinised by top management, with a view to preventing a recurrence. We appreciate all our passengers' continued patience and understanding in bearing with us as we strive to do better.

Dear Mr King.

Thank you for taking the time to write to us via Facebook with regards to your recent experience with Singapore Airlines.

We are sorry in learning of your disappointment with our baggage policy. We wish to explain, airlines impose charges on excess baggage to discourage passengers from carrying too much baggage, in view of weight and space considerations on the aircraft.

If I may also take this opportunity to explain, with effect from 15 November 2013, Singapore Airlines had increased the baggage allowance across all classes. For instance, Economy Class travellers are now eligible to carry 30kgs of check-in baggage (excluding USA and Brazil), which is a 10kg increase from the old policy. Informatively, with the increase in baggage allowance, the no-baggage waiver policy is strictly enforced and therefore, the check-in staff at Bangkok Airport was unable to offer extra baggage allowance.

Our records show that you and Mrs Makowski arrived at the counter with a total of 70kgs of check-in baggage. As you were in excess of 10kgs, the check-in staff were duly adhering to the baggage policy and had charged you a total of THB13260.00 (USD380.00). We remain apologetic for the disappointment that had been caused and wish to assure you that our staff at Bangkok Airport were duly adhering to the baggage policy.

Please allow me wish to explain that we are transparent with our baggage policy and the information in regards to our excess baggage charges is available on our website, to ensure that our passengers are well informed and not inconvenienced at the check in counters. Please refer to the following link for your perusal;
http://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/sg/travel-info/baggage/additional-baggage-charges/.

Mr King, we remain apologetic for the disappointment caused however thank you for the time taken to convey your feedback and allowing us the opportunity to respond.

Yours Sincerely,
Kimberley
Singapore Airlines Australia

Hi Chris, we do have a policy for oversized musical instruments such as a cello or guitar (http://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/sg/travel-info/baggage/non-standard-baggage/). However, in your situation, you should be able to carry your violin into the cabin, where your violin and its case will count towards your 7kg cabin baggage allowance. Please note as well that the sum of the dimensions of your violin case (length x height x width) should not exceed 115cm. Hi Michelle, sorry to hear that. We wish to share that the first sector is a domestic flight, hence it is compulsory for check in to be done with the operating carrier, which is Virgin America. In SFO, the domestic flights operate in a different terminal from the international flights as well. We regret if this was not communicated clearly to you earlier, but we seek your kind understanding as such. Thank you.

Frankly, I do not understand. Obviously, as a passenger, i am not aware of these complex transportation rules. From a passenger's point of view, i purchased the entire itinerary from SQ, and hence I check in at the SQ counter. If I had purchased the domestic tickets separately, I would have checked in with the domestic airline separately. Any anomaly should be communicated in advance and not result in the passenger wasting their time and efforts trying running around an extremely large airport to find their check in counter resulting in so much inconvenience. I was NEVER ever being informed that I should check in with Virgin for my flight. I frequent fly out of SFO, and aware how big SFO is. Imagine if I were some other passenger who has difficulties getting to one place to another, how much inconvenience would this be to move around such a big airport. Putting aside the issue that the appropriate check in counter was not communicated, it was extremely annoying that the SQ ground staff did not regard me as a passenger of SQ. She had on multiple times referred me to a Virgin America passenger and offered no help with all the troubles. I don't care what the transportation rules say as to which is the significant airline in such flight itinerary, but from a passenger point of view, I purchased the tickets from SQ, and I am only on Virgin America for 1.5 hours out of the total 15-20 hours flight, so I am a SQ customer. As a long time loyal customer of SQ for so many years, such customer services and attitude from the ground staff i extremely disappointing.

Hi Michelle, we'd like to share that the terminal to check in for your flight would be stated clearly on your itinerary / E-ticket. Nevertheless, we'll share your feedback with our team in SFO that staff should be mindful and tactful when communicating in such a situation. Thank you.

Singapore Airlines Both the flight confirmation and e-tickets do not state so. It states that it departs from terminal 2 (which is where virgin operates out from) but it doesn't state that I have to check in with Virgin at terminal 2. To me this makes sense because Virgin flies out of terminal so it departs from terminal 2. As I stated earlier, tix purchased with SQ and all flight segments have a Sq flight number, from a passenger point of view, I would have expected to check in with sq at the international terminal and not with virgin, and then head over to terminal 2 after check in for the flight. Like all other code share flights, I would typically check in with the airlines I purchased the tickets from and not the operating airline. If I need to so otherwise, this needs to be clearly communicated.

Now now... you're being real silly. Fact is you went to the wrong counter to check in. Claims to be a frequent traveler but don't know simple things like that?

Especially so when you went to the international terminal to check in for a domestic flight.

Count yourself lucky you didn't kick up a fuss about this in the US. You would have been arrested.

Fact is that I bought the itinerary entirely from SQ, and all flight segments have a sq flight number. There's always a possibility that I go to virgin and they pushed me back to sq. it's just all hindsight talk on your end. I talked to the flight supervisor on board, and while it may be a perfunctory response, he isn't aware of such rules either and doesn't think that it is an unreasonable action to check in with SQ on my end as he would probably have done the same. 

And I did kick a big fuss in the US, 2 US airports in fact. 

Anyway, it's really none of your business so I don't understand why you are poking your nose into his.

Ground crew at LAX freed up the entire row of economy seats to try to make good of the terrible check in experience. Unfortunately the row of seats had a malfunctioning handle which wouldn't stay up. 

Despite the bad experience on the ground, I have to say that the flight crew from LAX-ICN was great and emphatic of my ordeal at the US airports. They did help me with the malfunctioning handle. I didn't catch their name, but the Malay leading steward and the Korean leading stewardess (both had the green uniform) were really  great.

I am annoyed with the check in incident but I do recognize the  good customer service onboard the flight. Ground staff seriously need to improve their service tremendously. 

Don't bother with perfunctory apologies in your response. Because I am extremely sure that when I fly SFO - LAX - NRT later in December that there will be no improvement in terms of communications to ensure that the passengers go to the right check in counter. Of course, with this experience now, I will make sure that I get to the right check-in counter with Virgin in Dec.

I am a great supporter of SIA and am a frequent flyer.
On my usual routine to Shanghai for business this morning via SQ.
Checked in at the first class area as my colleague has PPS Solitaire membership (priority check in regardless of ticket class)

Both Male staff at the service desk greeted my colleague with the usual SIA vim:

Talice Ang Hi Talice, our website is designed to reflect the lowest available fares at the point of checking/booking. Due to the system's dynamic nature, fare availability can change very quickly, whether this means going up or going down. It is possible that the lower fare which you saw subsequently was due to other passengers having withdrawn their booking for the same flight, thus releasing back the cheaper fare into the system. If our passengers who secured a higher fare earlier via our website would like to change to the lower fare, they may contact our Reservations office to make the change, but this may be subject to fees respective to the terms and conditions of their purchased ticket. If the ticket was purchased via a travel agent, the agent will be able to advise whether a change is possible, and if so, what the associated change fees are, if any. We seek your understanding that it is not our intention to disadvantage our passengers in any way.

Going forward in the months and years ahead, airfares are expected to drop even further as the price of crude oil is expected to crash to the US$ 20's per barrel level. Moreover, increased competition from the Big 3 Middle Eastern carriers (Emirates, Etihad, and Qatar Airways), China Southern Airlines, Air China, and budget carriers will only drive down airfares in the long run. As an example, there's no hurry to purchase a ticket for Q3/Q4 2017 travel to Europe at the moment when many airlines are now advertising "Early Bird Special Discounted Fares to Europe for 2017 Travel" as they want the passenger's to lock-in at today's "Special" fares and generate their cash flow now rather than when the departure dates are much closer because of the risk of much lower airfares going forward.

Singapore Airlines, we were stuck on SQ377 for almost 7 hours in Milan. Finally the decision was made to cancel the flight.  As we got off the plane,  we were told that there would be ground staff waiting to give us instructions.  We took the shuttle to the airport; no ground staff in sight when we arrived.  We don't know where we are supposed to go. Most of us are queuing to get through immigration, but not really knowing if that's what we should be doing, or if we should head to the transit area. I appreciate that you cannot control technical issues and cancelled the flight due to safety concerns.  However, what you can control is ensuring that we at least get the basic information - where to go, what to do, who to talk to. We have been queuing for over 30 minutes now and still no one from SQ has appeared. The whole situation has been appallingly handled and honestly I expected more from an airline who prides itself in its service. #SQFail #SQ377

Feels more like no.1 worst airline from my current situation. Over 25 hours delay on SQ377 from Milan to SG and still waiting to board. SQ kept us on the plane on tarmac for 6 hours yesterday with no aircon until food ran out.  Deplaned only after 6 hours and SQ Milan ground staff at terminal in total disarray. Staff ineffective and disorganised. Passengers exhausted, confused, lost, angry and in state of disbelief. Saw a passenger faint and collapse on the ground. Had to stay overnight in some remote motel near the airport. Dinner provided consisted of plain tomato pasta and some water. Scheduled to board 1.20pm today but now 2.15pm and still waiting to board. Announcement said still checking technical issues and will update again in 20mins to an hour. SQ claims to be a premium airline and I paid premium price but got budget airline experience. Fly frequently on a range of airlines for work and leisure and SQ377 was hands down the worst airline experience I have had in my life.

Do you know 40000 children suffer from life limiting illness in England? Life- limiting conditions are conditions where there is no reasonable hope of cure and from which chilren will die before reaching adulthood. These conditions cause progressive deterioration which require 24 hour care with the care burden met by family members.

WE ARE IN NEED OF AN AIR TICKET SPONSORSHIP! Destination? As far as we can IN 30 hours! Malaysia? New zealand? Australia? Hong kong? We hope to raise awareness to as many people and collect as much fund as possible for the need.

What are you allowed for baby in terms of check in and carry on luggage?

Hi Corinne, for checked baggage, an infant is entitled to 10kg of baggage, as well as a fully collapsible stroller or pushchair and carry-cot or car seat. For carry-on baggage, you may carry infant's amenities and food for consumption (not exceeding 6kg and 40x30x10cm in dimension) on board with you on our flights, free of charge, in addition to your cabin baggage allowance. For more info on our baggage allowances, you may also refer to https://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/sg/travel-info/baggage/. thank you.

Hallo. I use to admire SQ every time I fly with SQ. You guys are doing superb job as always. I was kind of disappointed the last time my family and I flew with SQ from SFO to SIN to MDC. For some reason there were some of your personnel who didn't have sympathy with family with children. The problem started from SFO to SIN when the sit arraignment was done for us to sit together, but when we got into the airplane they intentionally put us apart. I thought it was just a mistake so with heavy heart I agree to do that even though we had a hard time going back and forth taking care of the kids while in the airplane. The problem persist when we came back from SIN to SFO, I felt embarrassed because I had to fight to get the same sit that to me really bother other passengers while we argue in the airplane. Our sit was actually prearrange while we still at MDC, but when we got into the airplane at SIG they intentionally change our sit. At last I really felt sorry because two elderly couple were ask by your stewardess to move so we as family could sit together. In fact those were our prearranged sit. I'm just hoping that this situation don't repeat again to other passengers. Or perhaps when we have another change to fly with SQ again.  I really think this is an isolated incidence even though it happened to us twice.

I would like to share my horrendous experience with Singapore Airlines. I was due to return to Singapore on SQ861, departing on 21st October, 340pm. I was informed by my colleagues in Hong Kong on Thursday morning that based on the information by Hong Kong Observatory (HKO), the typhoon will likely impact all flights on Friday. I immediately contacted SQ hotline on thurs late morning to fly out on Thursday night before the typhoon. I was told that the flights are full and SQ861 is still on schedule. I reached out them again on Thursday night and was given the same response. An hour later, I was informed via sms that SQ861 was cancelled and I have to called SQ hotline to make arrangement for alternative flight. 
When I reached out to them, I was told that all flights on sat and sun were full and the next available flight out is on Monday morning. 

First of all, I have made at least four international call to SQ and wasted more than 90 mins on the phone with them.

Secondly, they should know the potential impact of the storm and help provide alternatives to customers who are affected. They should not expect the customer who are overseas to call and make arrangement for themselves. I was lucky to be able to extend my stay at the hotel (thanks to W HK) by another three days but that disrupted my plans for the weekend.

Lastly, the customer support/service  is poorly informed and ill equipped to handle incidents of this magnitude. When I requested to be place on other airlines within the star alliance, the customer service has no clue and no ability to support the customer.
FYI, my colleague who reached out to Cathay pacific on Thursday morning (same time as me) was able to change her flight. 
As a customer who has accumulated more than one hundred thousand KF miles in a year, I believe there are airlines out there who will provide a better service. Goodbye Singapore Airlines, you will not be missed....

Sorry to hear this, Lennon. May we request for your booking reference number and contact details via SQ_Social@Singaporeair.com.sg, so that we can pass on your feedback to our customer relations colleagues for review? Thank you.

It wasn't an easy time for all of us, I have faith in SQ empowering their experienced and well-trained teams to make the right decisions for that fateful day. Thank you very much Ms. Dimple for your calm and prompt assistance to get us the first flight home (even if it was 3 days after). We are all distressed but we can all do our part not to aggravate what is beyond and the limitations. Cheers to all and hope everyone's already back home.

Hi Aileen, you can store the milk in our chillers but we have limited space, as the chillers are used for passengers' meals. Storage in the chillers is hence subject to space availability. We can only accept 100ml bottles to be stored in the chillers due to space constraints in our chillers on board.

As the temperature of the chillers is not controllable on board, we recommend you store the milk in a smaller cooler bag measuring 17cm x 17cm x 23cm or smaller, with ice packs or other cooling apparatus as required to ensure the milk is chilled. We'd suggest bringing enough breast milk as you need to nurse your infant for the entire journey. The combined weight of the infant food, breast milk and amenities you may bring on board should not exceed 6kg. This is in addition to your 7kg free cabin baggage allowance. Thank you.

3) Keep original boarding pass

5) Reset phone 
6) Give the phone back to Samsung mobile or dispose it

Hi James, we would like to assure you that we treat any incident seriously, and we will always cooperate fully with the relevant authorities with the view to avoiding a recurrence. In terms of ticket prices, while we cannot comment on the fares of our competitors, we try to roll out promotional fares from time to time for our passengers, be it via social media or on our website. Recently, we had our Great Singapore Airlines Getaway sale that was publicised via our social media and website platforms. We will continue to look out for further opportunities to provide further fare deals to our passengers in future.

I ha ENT read anywhere that you are increasing training standards, check rides, simulator work. Soft luggage is easier to manipulate into small spaces, such as overhead bins. Mostly extendable.

Accessibility is another perk of soft luggage. Having pockets on the front of the bag is very convenient. You can reach for things you'd like to keep handy, but may not need in your carry-on, such as a change of clothes, toiletries, a sweater, or an extra book.

If you have fragile items, packed well inside.  Request fr FRAGILE label to stick on the suitcase.

Hard - it can hold as much as you pack provided you roll your clothes. Mine is a MUJI brand that I bought at the Changi airport after the wheels of my soft case detached while in Ngurah Rai (2014). Since then, I became a fan of hard cases. 
Now whether you go for a hard or soft case, experience taught me to place a luggage strap at the center portion of your case to ease pressure on the zipper. A single luggage strap will do but if you can find a cross luggage straps then that is the best! Fly high!

I've flown a lot with Singapore Airlines already, I had great experiences to begin with but your services have been declining. I won't go into specifics but customer satisfactory in terms of handling and service should be kept up to high standards. Last year i asked when the company intended to give all customers free wifi during long haul flights but it's still a service to be paid for? Myself and many others find this UNACCEPTABLE in the year 2016. One specific company that does very well and offers free wifi service on their 777 and A380 fleet are Emirates. Why can't Singapore do "more"?

Dear Dominique, we agree that customer satisfaction and service should be kept up to high standards. At the same time, we also have to look at whether providing certain services free-of-charge, such as inflight wifi, is sustainable for us. But where we can, we will try to improve our passengers' overall inflight experience. We have lined up some plans for the future, and will share them with our passengers in due course. We are grateful for your support and hope we can continue looking forward to it as we endeavour to improve our passenger experience.

I still love to travel with your company but i have a feeling that upgrades/improvements have been put on hold and that the company is unsure of the future services they wish to provide or improve. Put that aside and i'm still a satisfied customer. Leg room, service, cabin hostesses and the great meals prove at which standard Singapore Airlines operates. Which is at a high standard. Very respectable, but with high standards come high demands. I firmly believe that "if possible" offering free wifi would please everybody travelling with you. Being the best means being able to offer the best services allround. I hope you guys can make it happen as it's otherwise extremely expensive and it could help reduce the stress load on a 12-13 hour flight. :)

Dominique Blondeel Dear Dominique, points duly noted. We appreciate that you have taken the time to share your candid feedback with us, and for how it is directing us to where we should be showing improvement. We hope to share some good news with our passengers as soon as we can :-)

Our Reference Number: 0000WaBYMG1Y0SF9
KrisFlyer Membership Number: 8086304029
Dear Mr Yong
Thank you for your reaching out to Singapore Airlines via the Facebook page regarding qualification for Elite Gold membership. We apologise for the delayed response to you query.
Our record shows that, since 2 October 2016 we have tried contacting you via your Singapore mobile phone, but were unable to reach you.

We are most appreciative of the time you have taken to give us your views and feedback with regard to our service as it is through such comments that we are able to monitor our services and keep abreast of customers' expectations. We are sorry to learn of your displeasure, for not being able to deliver a service that was up to your expectations in this instance.
Current mechanism for Elite Gold qualification and renewal does not allow excess Elite miles to be rolled over or carried forward to your next qualification period.  Even if the minimum requirement of Elite miles is accrued before the given period, the membership can only be renewed at the end of the qualification period as it cannot be shortened.  Although there is currently no plan to make any changes to the current KrisFlyer membership programme, please allow us to assure you that we are continuously reviewing and working on enhancing our frequent flyer programme. All constructive feedback, such as yours, will be collated and considered seriously.

Do allow us to share with you , we review members' accounts on a case-by-case basis and will assist members as much as possible as the end of their qualification period approaches.  During such evaluation, excess Elite mileage accrued in previous qualification periods will be one of the qualifying factors for consideration should there be a shortfall of Elite miles required for a membership renewal.

We hope this will give you some measure of assurance with regard to your membership renewal.

Mr Yong, thank you for writing to us and we look forward to being of service to you again.

Yours sincerely
Thasneem Hadhija
Customer Service Executive
Singapore Airlines

Herewith is a cop of my initial complaintI just returned from Tullamarine airport after dropping a 86 yr lady who was travelling by SQ 228 to Singapore and colombo. She was accompanying 2 others and as she was unabled to walk more than very very short distances she wanted to be booked with SQ due to its reputation. Going by the experience from the air lines I wish to comment on the pathetic and deplorable service. She was at the airport prior to the counters opening and eventually checked in around 1300 hrs. As she was unable to walk and as per airline policy she was told that she had to await arrival of an employee to take her by wheel chair. Hence around after 1415 when the SQ customer service desk was approached we were told that there was a personnel issue and we have to wait. By that time almost all passengers were checked in and a person came and wheeled one person and asked others to follow her by foot inspite of this 86 year old lady being unable to walk and she was seated on her wheelchair. This person also too this 86 yr lady's passport and boarding pass and disappeared. When we complained to the customer service department they phoned around and eventually the passport and boarding pass was returned and we were waiting for someone to take her to the aircraft as the accompanying passengers were not authorised to wheel her. We were concererned that she was not being attended to and eventually someone took her wheelchair after many visits to the customer service department. Hi Michael, we are not spraying our aircraft into London. Having said this, we would like to assure you that SIA takes measures both on the ground and on board to minimise the spread of all diseases, including Zika. These measures include proactive screening of passengers by airport ground personnel to ensure the safety of passengers on board the flight. If any passenger appears to be unwell, he or she will be asked to see a doctor immediately. We will not carry any passenger whom we believe is a risk to others on board. Our crew are also advised to inform us if they are unwell and not able to report for duty.
Thank you, if this changes I would really appreciate if you update me.
We live in a dangerous world, that's for sure.
Hi SIA - what about flights into and out of Taiwan? Am traveling in Nov and Dec w two young kids. Thanks.

Hi Wee-Ling, we are not spraying our aircraft into Taiwan. However, we would like to assure you that SIA takes measures both on the ground and on board to minimise the spread of all diseases, including Zika, and we will not carry any passenger whom we believe is a risk to others on board.

Hi Seney, we do allow passengers certain additional items on our flights, free of charge, in addition to your cabin baggage allowance (subject to country restrictions, where applicable). Such items will include ladies' handbag, camera/camera bag and document bags. Do note however, the maximum dimensions for these bags are 40x30x10cm each. If your item exceeds the total dimension of 80cm (the length, width and height combined), it will be counted as part of your standard cabin baggage allowance. You will then be required to check in either your cabin bag or the additional item. We hope this helps to clarify. Thank you.

Hi! For premium economy class what are the amenities offered on board? Pls advise, thx!
Hi Terence, amenities such as flight socks and eyeshades are offered on board. Thank you.
Im quite curious about the range of drinks offered on board; can we request for wines or champagne? Are they offered for other seat type like biz class or 1st class entitlement?

Hi Terence, yes you would be able to request for wines and champagnes in premium economy class. Different brands of wines and champagne is offered in first, business and premium economy class.

For more information on what its like to fly on premium economy class with us, do visit this link to know more - https://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/us/flying-withus/cabins/premium-economy-class/
Is the USB port available in the cabin supports fast charging for smartphones? Or normal speed charging? Pls advise
Terence Ho Yoke Siong Hi Terence, it should be normal speed.
Are we able to choose the type of food offered on board through the menu? Or isit already fix items throughout the journey?

Terence Ho Yoke Siong Hi Terence, Premium Economy passengers can choose Book the Cook options from selected departure points. You can view the menu here: https://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/us/flying-withus/dining/book-the-cook/.
Will there be enough leg room in between rows of premium economy class?
Terence Ho Yoke Siong Hi Terence, with a seat pitch of 38 inches as opposed to the 32 inches in regular Economy, we certainly hope so :-)
What is the meaning of the term "airbus" used to describe a plane?
Terence Ho Yoke Siong Hi Terence, Airbus is the name of the aircraft manufacturer. Another aircraft manufacturer would be Boeing.
Can I say that most SIA planes have spacious seating plan regardless of category?
Hi Terence, there are preferred seats available for purchased if you would like to enjoy a larger legroom. Hope to see you on board soon! :)

Mike Forrestall Hi Mike, not necessarily. It depends on the fare booking class that is used for the selected flights as well. Hi Jo, unfortunately, for safety and security reasons, passengers are not allowed to carry baby strollers in their carry-on baggage. You are advised to check in or put the item in your checked baggage instead. Additionally, you may find out more on our baggage restrictions via our website: https://www.singaporeair.com/en_UK/us/travel-info/baggage/baggage-restrictions/. Thank you.

@singaporeairlines if our stroller goes into the hold, are we able to retrieve it for a lay over in Singapore before continuing onto London, or alternatively do you have strollers available to use in the airport?

Hi Jo, you will be able to loan strollers at Changi Airport, on a first-come first-served basis, from the Information and Customer Service counters located across the terminals. You may also find out more info via the Travelling with Children section on Changi Airport's website: http://www.changiairport.com/en/passenger-guide/special-assistance.html.

Well Singapore Airlines I won't be doing that again ! I assume that your flight from Singapore to Manchester via Munich does the same thing every trip ie passengers stay on board while you clean etc ? Well I'm sorry but we won't be no more. It was a complete shambles after a 12 hour flight to then be told to " stay in your seats and not use the toilets". Then Munich airport staff wondering up n down trying to count people as we got fed up waiting just sitting and then when you could move you were then getting pushed about by cleaning staff trying to clean round you for new passengers to board the plane. Most of these staff could not speak English or where even polite as they pushed passed other people and including YOUR OWN flight crews. It would of made more sense to have emptied the plane fully so all staff had room to work especially as there were very few passengers left most if not all were economy class ( or is this the reason we got treat like this ? ) I guess I'm not the first or will be the last to complain about our treatment, and I'm sorry but it spoiled  a pleasant holiday away for a special birthday which my wife had saved hard to take us on. 
Yours VERY unhappy travellers   
Mr & Mrs Hayzelden.
